definition: The term "scheinbar" refers to something that appears to be true or real, but may not necessarily be so. It is commonly used to describe situations, actions, or appearances that are deceptive or misleading.

examples.german: Es ist scheinbar unmöglich, diese Aufgabe zu lösen.
examples.english: It seems impossible to solve this task.

examples.german: Er ist scheinbar sehr glücklich mit seiner Entscheidung.
examples.english: He appears to be very happy with his decision.

examples.german: Das scheinbar einfache Problem entpuppte sich als äußerst komplex.
examples.english: The seemingly simple problem turned out to be extremely complex.

examples.german: Scheinbar hat sie vergessen, den Termin abzusagen.
examples.english: Apparently, she forgot to cancel the appointment.

examples.german: Scheinbar hat er keine Ahnung, was er tun soll.
examples.english: Seemingly, he has no idea what to do.
